segment.source: How to Delete a Package Version
segment.target: How to Delete a Package Version

segment.source: How to Delete a Package Version
segment.target: How to Delete a Package Version

segment.source: How to Delete a Package Version
segment.target: How to Delete a Package Version

segment.source: From the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, for a package that has multiple versions, you can use the following procedure to delete one or more versions and still stream the remaining versions of the package.
segment.target: From the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, for a package that has multiple versions, you can use the following procedure to delete one or more versions and still stream the remaining versions of the package.

segment.source: You might do this to more effectively manage files on the server or to remove an obsolete version.
segment.target: You might do this to more effectively manage files on the server or to remove an obsolete version.

segment.source: When you choose to delete a version, a confirmation box reminds you that client computers might still be using it.
segment.target: When you choose to delete a version, a confirmation box reminds you that client computers might still be using it.

segment.source: You should advise users to exit and unload any applications before you remove a version that is in use.
segment.target: You should advise users to exit and unload any applications before you remove a version that is in use.

segment.source: In the left panel of the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, expand Packages.
segment.target: In the left panel of the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, expand Packages.

segment.source: Click the package that contains the version you want to delete.
segment.target: Click the package that contains the version you want to delete.

segment.source: In the center pane, right-click the version of the package you want to delete and choose Delete.
segment.target: In the center pane, right-click the version of the package you want to delete and choose Delete.

segment.source: Read the confirmation window, and click Yes to complete the action.
segment.target: Read the confirmation window, and click Yes to complete the action.

segment.source: If you have users in disconnected operation, their applications will be replaced with the new versions the next time they connect to the servers.
segment.target: If you have users in disconnected operation, their applications will be replaced with the new versions the next time they connect to the servers.

segment.source: After you are sure all users have updated applications, you can delete old versions.
segment.target: After you are sure all users have updated applications, you can delete old versions.

segment.source: How to Manage Packages in the Server Management Console
segment.target: How to Manage Packages in the Server Management Console
